image.altText: Gail Ferrari-Hirst and Russell Hirst embrace while standing

props.synopsis: Just 18 days before Russell Wayne Hirst died of a cardiac event in November 2021, superannuation giant Cbus cancelled his insurance policy, leaving the beneficiary of his account in a year-long fight to have her claim approved.

title.children: 'Absolutely unacceptable': Cbus cancels customer's insurance days before his death

image.altText: A dark and pointed ballistic missile pointing skyward on a backdrop of forestry

props.synopsis: The country's defence ministry says Ukraine fired six US-made tactical missiles known as ATACMS at a Russian military facility in the Bryansk border region.

title.children: Russia claims Ukraine fired six US-made missiles at a Russian military facility

image.altText: A man looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride has given an interview to the ABC from the Canberra prison where he is serving a sentence of more than five years for leaking secret military documents to journalists.

title.children: Jailed whistleblower David McBride says he has faced threats in Canberra prison

image.altText: Central Station in Sydney

props.synopsis: Industrial action will freeze all train services across Greater Sydney from Thursday night to Sunday morning. The impacts of this could be heightened by congestion and reduced access to emergency services.

title.children: A Sydney train shutdown will halt services for the weekend. What does this mean for Sydney?

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a wall of American flags.

props.synopsis: It's now eight years since Salena Zito made probably the most pellucid observation of all about Trump: "The press takes him literally, but not seriously; his supporters take him seriously, but not literally."

title.children: Literalism in politics is kind of dead, or at least heading that way, and we can't say we weren't warned

image.altText: Vladimir Putin wearing a dark suit, tie and blue shirt sitting emotionless at a wooden desk in front of a Russian flag

props.synopsis: The new doctrine says the Kremlin would consider a nuclear strike in response to the use of conventional weapons against Russia or Belarus.

title.children: Vladimir Putin lowers Russia's threshold for using nuclear weapons

image.altText: Palestinians with backpack cary household items as they flee along an unsealed road that runs between damaged buildings.

props.synopsis: The IDF's siege of northern Gaza is now into its second month, leading many to question whether Israel has adopted a controversial plan to conquer the area.

title.children: Former general who plans to starve 'combatants' out of northern Gaza slams critics

image.altText: Kusini Yengi  scores

props.synopsis: The Socceroos meet Bahrain at the National Stadium in Riffa, hoping to put right their shock defeat on the Gold Coast in September. Follow live.

title.children: Socceroos score inside 40 seconds to take the lead against Bahrain in crucial World Cup qualifier

image.altText: A woman with short auburn hair looks at the ground while walking through a door

props.synopsis: The Frenchwoman and her ex-husband have given their final statements in court as the mass rape trial involving 51 men enters its final stages.

title.children: 'This scar will never heal': Gisele Pelicot calls for 'macho' culture to change attitude about rape

image.altText: Spencer Porter

props.synopsis: The Victorian consumer watchdog alleges Spencer Porter, 25, accepted $1.3 million to build tiny homes but failed to supply them in a reasonable time.

title.children: Young entrepreneur faces charges for accepting $1.3 million in payments and failing to supply tiny homes

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: The parents of Holly Bowles and Bianca Jones remain at their bedsides in separate Thai hospitals as the Melbourne women fight for their lives after drinking tainted alcohol.

title.children: Teens were on 'incredible adventure' through Asia before apparent methanol poisoning in Laos

image.altText: A baby wearing a hair tie smiles while playing with toys in a living room

props.synopsis: An inquest will consider how a manipulative father was able to take his life and that of his baby daughter on the same day he was allowed access to her.

title.children: Man who killed baby daughter at Whispering Wall breached non-contact order 149 times

image.altText: A group of people march through a city street

props.synopsis: A proposed bill that won't become law has become a flashpoint on race relations at a critical moment in the fraught 180-year-old conversation about how New Zealand should honour the promises made to First Nations people.

title.children: Māori queen among thousands to march on NZ's parliament amid controversial treaty bill

image.altText: A long exposure shows a nuclear plant illuminated at night, with a white cloud of steam emerging from the top of two reactors.

props.synopsis: Acting Prime Minister Richard Marles says the agreement, which Australia had been expected to join, is not relevant to the country's circumstances.

title.children: Australia declines to join UK and US-led nuclear energy development pact

image.altText: Screenshot of three police officers outside a house next to an aircon unit and a person on the ground

props.synopsis: Footage of a man being shoved into a wall by a police officer before being dragged through a front yard has been shared on social media, with SA Police confirming a formal complaint has been made about the incident.

title.children: 'Confronting' footage of man being shoved into a wall by police officer part of formal complaint

image.altText: Harvey Norman Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: Harvey Norman and Latitude Financial announce plans to appeal against a court ruling they misled customers in TV, radio and newspapers advertisements run between January 2020 and August 2021.

title.children: Harvey Norman and Latitude Financial to fight court ruling they misled customers

image.altText: A middle-aged man staring into camera

props.synopsis: In a landmark Hong Kong national security case, 45 pro-democracy activists, academics and former politicians have been sentenced to jail for up to 10 years.

title.children: Australian Gordon Ng among dozens of pro-democracy activists sentenced to jail in Hong Kong for 'subversion'

image.altText: A graphic shows a woman's face and the Bunnings Warehouse shopfront in the background

props.synopsis: The Privacy Commissioner finds Bunnings Warehouse interfered with the privacy of its customers by using facial recognition without consent in 63 of its stores over a three-year period.

title.children: Bunnings told to destroy 'faceprint' data after landmark ruling on facial recognition use

image.altText: Lawyer Bryan Wrench part of Alan Jones legal team leaves Day Street police station

props.synopsis: NSW Police say following further legal advice, it could be revealed the 83-year-old veteran broadcaster has been charged with an additional two counts of assault with act of indecency relating to a ninth alleged victim.

title.children: Alan Jones charged with additional offences relating to ninth alleged victim

image.altText: A woman with dark hair standing draped in a blue and yellow Ukrainian flag alongside protesters holding white placards

props.synopsis: The federal government should reopen Australia's embassy in Ukraine, continue providing military assistance to Kyiv and set up a "one-stop-shop" to ensure aid is managed efficiently, a parliamentary inquiry has recommended.

title.children: Inquiry recommends Australia reopens embassy in Ukraine

image.altText: A town sign in bush, behind it multiple signposts to different towns, town centre, hotel, museum, trees behind.

props.synopsis: Harry James Creagh used his position to defraud hundreds of thousands of dollars from the post office in Ongerup.

title.children: Man jailed after embezzling $450,000 from Australia Post for gambling debts

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: It seems despite the Tasmanian government's assurances it wouldn't back down from its commitment to pokies reform, long-held concerns the premier would walk back support for a cashless gaming card were on the money.

title.children: Tasmania's resolve for chasing nation-leading gambling reform accused of collapsing like a house of cards

image.altText: Generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: Victoria's strict political donations laws will be challenged in the High Court, with a group of independent and minor party candidates arguing they are "unconstitutional" and unfairly favour established major parties.

title.children: Group of candidates to challenge Victoria's political donations laws in High Court

image.altText: The Taj Mahal is obscured by smog in India.

props.synopsis: Measures to curb pollution such as installing more pollution monitors and pushing for a switch to cleaner fuels are yet to yield significant results.

title.children: 'It's an apocalypse': Smog in India, Pakistan up to 60 times safe level spurs calls for action

image.altText: Woman in wheelchair at graduation ceremony

props.synopsis: Jade McAlear sustained multiple fractures and was in a coma in Royal Melbourne Hospital for four months. She is now living with an acquired brain injury (ABI).

title.children: Jade lives with acquired brain injury and wants people to stop treating her like a child

image.altText: An Aboriginal lady with grey hair looks at the camera

props.synopsis: In lieu of a formal truth-telling hearing, members of the Cherbourg community have shared their experiences of life and restrictions in the Aboriginal settlement.

title.children: 'Get on board or get out of the way': Cherbourg community goes it alone on truth-telling

image.altText: The high-rise towers in Melbourne CBD in the distance, with green trees and houses in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government's plan to allow the development of dozens of new residential towers near suburban transport hubs will turn Melbourne into a "fourth-rate city", a leading urban planning expert warns.

title.children: Leading planner warns planned zoning changes will make Melbourne a 'fourth-rate city'

image.altText: A drone shot showing bleached coral.

props.synopsis: Large sections of the Great Barrier Reef appear to have been smashed by climate change and cyclones this year, with one reef near Lizard Island losing nearly three quarters of its coral cover since the beginning of the year.

title.children: 'Our worst fears': Scientists warn of damage to Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: Grace Piscopo walks to court in the Perth CBD.

props.synopsis: Nothing appeared out of the ordinary the day a cryptocurrency investor is accused of murdering his mother, the man's social media influencer ex-partner tells a Perth court.

title.children: Instagram influencer says ex-partner appeared 'ordinary' on day he allegedly murdered his mother

image.altText: People walking along a river path, holding umbrellas.

props.synopsis: Locally heavy falls have already resulted in flash flooding across parts of Brisbane, the Scenic Rim and Western Downs.

title.children: Flash flooding possible as Queensland braces for more wet weather

image.altText: Newman Lightning Darren Field hero

props.synopsis: A heavy downpour, hail and lightning which hit "out of nowhere" has left a train of destruction in Newman and the SES is warning residents to be prepared for similar weather events this wet season.

title.children: Damaging storms have Pilbara residents predicting 'wild' cyclone season

image.altText: Man in a bright green shirt with a long grey beard standing in front of a bus.

props.synopsis: Roofs were ripped off and windows "exploded" in a wild storm that left Bill Tanner sleeping in a bus lent to him by a neighbour as other residents of the tiny town of Carinda pick up the pieces.

title.children: Bill's sleeping in a bus after outback tempest that 'sounded like a freight train' wrecked homes

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The crown prosecution in a manslaughter trial says no-one was at risk of injury from a great-grandmother who died after being tasered by a police officer, but the defence says it was the accused's "job to obtain a resolution".

title.children: Jury hears police officer who tasered a 95yo woman was 'fed up, impatient, not prepared to wait any longer'

image.altText: Flames coming out of the ground with a fire fighter in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Israel has intensified its bombardment in and around the Lebanese capital over the last week, and Hezbollah has kept up missile fire into Israel, even as US-led diplomacy to halt the fighting has progressed.

title.children: Lebanon, Hezbollah agree to US proposal for ceasefire with Israel

image.altText: A young male soldier in uniform is photographed in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Queensland police tell an inquest into the death of Steven Angus, 52, that "lethal force" was the only option when Mr Angus confronted them with knives.

title.children: Army veteran urged police to 'put him to sleep' before shooting, inquest told
